name: Wing Luke Museum Affiliated Area
description: More than a museum, the Wing is an experience. A chance to truly understand what it was - and is - to be Asian American in the Pacific Northwest. Take a guided tour of a historic hotel and learn the inside story about what makes the local Chinatown-International District unique. Visitors explore thought-provoking exhibitions of real stories, including actor and martial arts master Bruce Lee.
shortDescription: More than a museum, the Wing is an experience. A chance to truly understand what it was - and is - to be Asian American in the Pacific Northwest. Take a guided tour of a historic hotel and learn the i...

operatingHours.description:
For current hours, please see www.wingluke.org/visit/ or call 206.623.5124.

The Museum is closed New Year’s Day, Juneteenth, July 4th, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and occasionally in the case of inclement weather.

climate.weatherDescription: Seattle has a temperate climate with average winter temperatures in the 50s and average summer temperatures in the 70s. Overcast skies and light rain are common from October through May.

images.title: Nippon Kan Theatre curtain
images.altText: theatre curtain painted with Japanese characters advertising local businesses
images.caption: Nippon Kan Theatre curtain, painted with logos and ads for local Japanese-American businesses

images.title: Nippon Kan Theatre curtain detail
images.altText: Japanese characters from advertisements are painted on a theatre curtain
images.caption: Detail of advertisements from the Nippon Kan Theatre curtain that hangs in the museum

images.title: "Letter Cloud"
images.altText: a mobile of letters written on white paper hangs in the museum lobby
images.caption: “Letter Cloud,” by Erin Shie Palmer, is made up of letters written by immigrants to family and friends
